trans-unit.source: Lists the different sizes for virtual machines and their capacities.
trans-unit.target: Lists the different sizes for virtual machines and their capacities.

trans-unit.source: This article describes the available sizes and options for the virtual machine-based compute resources you can use to run your apps and workloads.
trans-unit.target: This article describes the available sizes and options for the virtual machine-based compute resources you can use to run your apps and workloads.

trans-unit.source: It also provides deployment considerations to be aware of when you're planning to use these resources.
trans-unit.target: It also provides deployment considerations to be aware of when you're planning to use these resources.

trans-unit.source: Azure Virtual Machines and Cloud Services are two of several types of compute resources offered by Azure.
trans-unit.target: Azure Virtual Machines and Cloud Services are two of several types of compute resources offered by Azure.

trans-unit.source: For explanations, see [Compute hosting options provided by Azure](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=311926).
trans-unit.target: For explanations, see [Compute hosting options provided by Azure](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=311926).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] To see related Azure limits, see [Azure subscription and service limits, quotas, and constraints](../azure-subscription-service-limits.md).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] To see related Azure limits, see [Azure subscription and service limits, quotas, and constraints](../azure-subscription-service-limits.md).

trans-unit.source: Virtual machines are available in two tiers: basic and standard.
trans-unit.target: Virtual machines are available in two tiers: basic and standard.

trans-unit.source: Both types offer a choice of sizes, but the basic tier doesn’t provide some capabilities available in the standard tier, such as load-balancing and auto-scaling.
trans-unit.target: Both types offer a choice of sizes, but the basic tier doesn’t provide some capabilities available in the standard tier, such as load-balancing and auto-scaling.

trans-unit.source: The standard tier of sizes consists of different series: A, D, DS, G, and GS.
trans-unit.target: The standard tier of sizes consists of different series: A, D, DS, G, and GS.

trans-unit.source: Considerations for some of these sizes include:
trans-unit.target: Considerations for some of these sizes include:

trans-unit.source: D-series VMs are designed to run applications that demand higher compute power and temporary disk performance.
trans-unit.target: D-series VMs are designed to run applications that demand higher compute power and temporary disk performance.

trans-unit.source: D-series VMs provide faster processors, a higher memory-to-core ratio, and a solid-state drive (SSD) for the temporary disk.
trans-unit.target: D-series VMs provide faster processors, a higher memory-to-core ratio, and a solid-state drive (SSD) for the temporary disk.

trans-unit.source: For details, see the announcement on the Azure blog, [New D-Series Virtual Machine Sizes](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2014/09/22/new-d-series-virtual-machine-sizes/).
trans-unit.target: For details, see the announcement on the Azure blog, [New D-Series Virtual Machine Sizes](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2014/09/22/new-d-series-virtual-machine-sizes/).

trans-unit.source: G-series VMs offer the biggest size and best performance and run on hosts that have Intel Xeon E5 V3 family processors.
trans-unit.target: G-series VMs offer the biggest size and best performance and run on hosts that have Intel Xeon E5 V3 family processors.

trans-unit.source: DS-series and GS-series VMs can use Premium Storage, which provides high-performance, low-latency storage for I/O intensive workloads.
trans-unit.target: DS-series and GS-series VMs can use Premium Storage, which provides high-performance, low-latency storage for I/O intensive workloads.

trans-unit.source: These VMs use solid-state drives (SSDs) to host a virtual machine’s disks and also provide a local SSD disk cache.
trans-unit.target: These VMs use solid-state drives (SSDs) to host a virtual machine’s disks and also provide a local SSD disk cache.

trans-unit.source: Premium Storage is available in certain regions.
trans-unit.target: Premium Storage is available in certain regions.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Premium Storage: High-performance storage for Azure virtual machine workloads](../storage-premium-storage-preview-portal.md).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Premium Storage: High-performance storage for Azure virtual machine workloads](../storage-premium-storage-preview-portal.md).

trans-unit.source: The size of the virtual machine affects the pricing.
trans-unit.target: The size of the virtual machine affects the pricing.

trans-unit.source: The size also affects the processing, memory, and storage capacity of the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: The size also affects the processing, memory, and storage capacity of the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Storage costs are calculated separately based on used pages in the storage account.
trans-unit.target: Storage costs are calculated separately based on used pages in the storage account.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Virtual Machines Pricing Details](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/virtual-machines/) and [Azure Storage Pricing](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/storage/).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Virtual Machines Pricing Details](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/virtual-machines/) and [Azure Storage Pricing](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/storage/).

trans-unit.source: For more details about storage for VMss, see [About disks and VHDs for virtual machines ](virtual-machines-disks-vhds.md).
trans-unit.target: For more details about storage for VMss, see [About disks and VHDs for virtual machines ](virtual-machines-disks-vhds.md).

trans-unit.source: The following considerations might help you decide on a size:
trans-unit.target: The following considerations might help you decide on a size:

trans-unit.source: The A0\Basic_A0 size is available only by using Azure SDK version 1.3 or later.
trans-unit.target: The A0\Basic_A0 size is available only by using Azure SDK version 1.3 or later.

trans-unit.source: A1\Basic_A1 is the smallest size recommended for production workloads.
trans-unit.target: A1\Basic_A1 is the smallest size recommended for production workloads.

trans-unit.source: Select a virtual machine that has four or eight CPU cores when using SQL Server Enterprise Edition.
trans-unit.target: Select a virtual machine that has four or eight CPU cores when using SQL Server Enterprise Edition.

trans-unit.source: Some of the physical hosts in Azure data centers may not support larger virtual machine sizes, such as A5 – A11\.
trans-unit.target: Some of the physical hosts in Azure data centers may not support larger virtual machine sizes, such as A5 – A11\.

trans-unit.source: As a result, you may see the error message **Failed to configure virtual machine <machine name>** or **Failed to create virtual machine <machine name>** when resizing an existing virtual machine to a new size; creating a new virtual machine in a virtual network created before April 16, 2013; or adding a new virtual machine to an existing cloud service.
trans-unit.target: As a result, you may see the error message **Failed to configure virtual machine <machine name>** or **Failed to create virtual machine <machine name>** when resizing an existing virtual machine to a new size; creating a new virtual machine in a virtual network created before April 16, 2013; or adding a new virtual machine to an existing cloud service.

trans-unit.source: See the topic [Error: “Failed to configure virtual machine”](https://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/en-US/9693f56c-fcd3-4d42-850e-5e3b56c7d6be/error-failed-to-configure-virtual-machine-with-a5-a6-or-a7-vm-size?forum=WAVirtualMachinesforWindows) on the support forum for workarounds for each deployment scenario.
trans-unit.target: See the topic [Error: “Failed to configure virtual machine”](https://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/en-US/9693f56c-fcd3-4d42-850e-5e3b56c7d6be/error-failed-to-configure-virtual-machine-with-a5-a6-or-a7-vm-size?forum=WAVirtualMachinesforWindows) on the support forum for workarounds for each deployment scenario.

trans-unit.source: The A8/A10 and A9/A11 virtual machine sizes have the same capacities.
trans-unit.target: The A8/A10 and A9/A11 virtual machine sizes have the same capacities.

trans-unit.source: The A8 and A9 virtual machine instances include an additional network adapter that is connected to a remote direct memory access (RDMA) network for fast communication between virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: The A8 and A9 virtual machine instances include an additional network adapter that is connected to a remote direct memory access (RDMA) network for fast communication between virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: The A8 and A9 instances are designed for high-performance computing applications that require constant and low-latency communication between nodes during execution, for example, applications that use the Message Passing Interface (MPI).
trans-unit.target: The A8 and A9 instances are designed for high-performance computing applications that require constant and low-latency communication between nodes during execution, for example, applications that use the Message Passing Interface (MPI).

trans-unit.source: The A10 and A11 virtual machine instances do not include the additional network adapter.
trans-unit.target: The A10 and A11 virtual machine instances do not include the additional network adapter.

trans-unit.source: A10 and A11 instances are designed for high-performance computing applications that do not require constant and low-latency communication between nodes, also known as parametric or embarrassingly parallel applications.
trans-unit.target: A10 and A11 instances are designed for high-performance computing applications that do not require constant and low-latency communication between nodes, also known as parametric or embarrassingly parallel applications.

trans-unit.source: This table shows limits that apply regardless of a virtual machine's size, for virtual machines created using the Service Management deployment model.
trans-unit.target: This table shows limits that apply regardless of a virtual machine's size, for virtual machines created using the Service Management deployment model.

trans-unit.source: This table shows limits that apply regardless of a virtual machine's size, for virtual machines created using the Resource Manager deployment model.
trans-unit.target: This table shows limits that apply regardless of a virtual machine's size, for virtual machines created using the Resource Manager deployment model.

trans-unit.source: The following tables show the sizes and the capacities they provide.
trans-unit.target: The following tables show the sizes and the capacities they provide.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Storage capacity is represented by using 1024^3 bytes as the unit of measurement for GB.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Storage capacity is represented by using 1024^3 bytes as the unit of measurement for GB.

trans-unit.source: This is sometimes referred to as gibibyte, or base 2 definition.
trans-unit.target: This is sometimes referred to as gibibyte, or base 2 definition.

trans-unit.source: When comparing sizes that use different base systems, remember that base 2 sizes may appear smaller than base 10 but for any specific size (such as 1 GB) a base 2 system provides more capacity than a base 10 system, because 1024^3 is greater than 1000^3.
trans-unit.target: When comparing sizes that use different base systems, remember that base 2 sizes may appear smaller than base 10 but for any specific size (such as 1 GB) a base 2 system provides more capacity than a base 10 system, because 1024^3 is greater than 1000^3.

trans-unit.source: Note: For information and considerations about using this size, see About the A8, A9, A10, and A11 compute intensive instances.
trans-unit.target: Note: For information and considerations about using this size, see About the A8, A9, A10, and A11 compute intensive instances.

trans-unit.source: Note: For information and considerations about using this size, see About the A8, A9, A10, and A11 compute intensive instances.
trans-unit.target: Note: For information and considerations about using this size, see About the A8, A9, A10, and A11 compute intensive instances.

trans-unit.source: Note: For information and considerations about using this size, see About the A8, A9, A10, and A11 compute intensive instances.
trans-unit.target: Note: For information and considerations about using this size, see About the A8, A9, A10, and A11 compute intensive instances.

trans-unit.source: Note: For information and considerations about using this size, see About the A8, A9, A10, and A11 compute intensive instances.
trans-unit.target: Note: For information and considerations about using this size, see About the A8, A9, A10, and A11 compute intensive instances.

trans-unit.source: *The maximum input/output operations per second (IOPS) and throughput (bandwidth) possible with a DS series VM is affected by the size of the disk.
trans-unit.target: *The maximum input/output operations per second (IOPS) and throughput (bandwidth) possible with a DS series VM is affected by the size of the disk.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Premium Storage: High-performance storage for Azure virtual machine workloads](../storage-premium-storage-preview-portal.md).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Premium Storage: High-performance storage for Azure virtual machine workloads](../storage-premium-storage-preview-portal.md).
